focus_area: CubeSat-based Asteroid Detection and Planetary Defense
mission: To develop affordable, rapidly deployable CubeSat constellations for early detection and tracking of near-Earth asteroids and space debris, enhancing planetary defense capabilities.

key_innovations: Miniaturized wide-field optical sensors with AI-powered detection algorithms
Distributed sensor fusion for multi-angle asteroid tracking
Edge computing for real-time threat assessment
Autonomous orbit determination and trajectory prediction
Low-cost mass production techniques for rapid constellation deployment

problem_statement: Current ground-based asteroid detection systems have significant blind spots, limited sky coverage, and weather dependencies. NASA's 2005 Congressional mandate to detect 90% of near-Earth objects larger than 140m is still unmet. The 2013 Chelyabinsk meteor (20m diameter) went undetected, causing extensive damage. Space-based detection offers 24/7 coverage, no atmospheric interference, and earlier warning times critical for planetary defense.
solution: A constellation of 12-24 specialized CubeSats in strategic orbits providing continuous sky coverage. Each satellite uses advanced CMOS sensors, machine learning algorithms for automated detection, and constellation-wide data fusion to track asteroids weeks earlier than ground systems. The system costs 100x less than traditional space telescopes while providing superior coverage.

team.name: Dr. Sarah Chen
team.background: PhD in Aerospace Engineering from MIT, 8 years at NASA JPL working on Near-Earth Object detection missions, led development of machine learning algorithms for NEOWISE

team.name: Dr. Marcus Rodriguez
team.background: PhD in Optical Systems from Caltech, former SpaceX Starlink engineer, expert in miniaturized space optics and CubeSat design

team.name: Dr. Emily Wang
team.background: PhD in Computer Science from Stanford, specialized in computer vision and ML for astronomical surveys, formerly at Palomar Observatory

team.name: James Mitchell
team.background: MS Aerospace Engineering, 12 years experience in CubeSat development at Planet Labs and Spire Global, led 15+ successful orbital missions

market_opportunity.market_size: $2.8B planetary defense and space situational awareness market by 2030
market_opportunity.competitive_advantage: 100x cost reduction, 24/7 coverage, faster detection, scalable constellation architecture

achievements: Prototype sensor payload developed and lab-tested
AI detection algorithm achieving 94% accuracy on synthetic asteroid data
Partnerships with University of Colorado for CubeSat bus integration
MOA signed with NASA Ames for ground station support
next_milestones: Achieve operational capability with 12+ satellites by 2028

nsf_sbir_phase1.purpose: Complete engineering development of flight-ready optical payload, validate detection algorithms with on-orbit demonstration, and establish technical feasibility for full constellation deployment
key_activities: Finalize sensor design for space environment

intellectual_property.trade_secrets: Proprietary sensor calibration algorithms and orbit optimization methods

social_impact: Protecting Earth from asteroid impacts saves lives and infrastructure. Our technology enables early warning systems for planetary defense, advances space situational awareness for satellite safety, and democratizes access to space-based Earth protection through affordable CubeSat technology.
